titleStmt.title: John M. Phipps to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4623

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To Thomas E. Bramlett his excellency
Gov.. of the Commonwealth of Kentucky..

Sir your humble petitioner John M. Phipps would represent to your honor that Sometime in the year 1862 he was arrested and taken before S. L. Prater a Justice of the peace for Magoffin County under a charge of Fornication and was fined the Sum of Ten dollars he also represents that he was arrested in the year 1863 and brought before A P. Cooper ^JP.^ under a charge of fornication and was fined the sum of Ten dollars which prossecutions was Malicious which fines has been replevied and the Execution's now in the hands of the sheriff of Magoffin County for collection unless restrained by your honor payment will be enforced Your petitioner further represents that he is a private Soldier in Co D, 45th Regt Ky Vols and that his security is likely to have the fines to pay or is greatly harrassed of by the sheriff of said county on account of the circumstances surrounding this petitioner he would therefore ask your honor to remit said fines, that this petitioner is a poor man and incumbered with a large family
the undersigned petitioners Subscribers Join in the prayer with the within named J.. M.. Phipps for the remission of his fines

Soldiers Names in the 45th Regt Ky. Vols
A. P. Cooper Esqr..
J. W. Helton
Allen Daulton
Constantine Conley
F. N. Literal
Henry Harrison
Rolein litteal
Miles lacy
Robert Meade
Saml Williams
Green Puckett
William Cooper
Edward Adams

Magoffin Co
vs
J. M. Phipps
2 Judgts
Fornication
Remitted
27th Feby 1864

Remit except costs & fees
Tho E Bramlette
